1.text: Lightly grease a lollipop mold with cooking spray.

2.text: Combine the sugar, corn syrup, and water in a small saucepan over medium heat.

3.text: Clip a candy thermometer to the side of the saucepan.

4.text: Bring the mixture to a boil, then continue to cook it until it reaches the "hard-crack" stage.

5.text: Take the saucepan off the stove, then stir in your flavoring oil and gel food coloring, if desired.

6.text: Wait for the mixture to stop bubbling, then pour it into your molds using a metal spoon.

8.text: Wait for the candy to harden before you take it out of the mold.

9.text: Combine the sugar, water, and honey in a saucepan over medium heat.

10.text: Wait for the sugar to dissolve, then clip the candy thermometer to the side of the pot.

11.text: Turn the heat on to high, let the mixture come to a boil, then wait for it to reach the "hard crack" stage.

12.text: Take the saucepan off the stove, then stir in your flavorings, if desired.

13.text: Pour small drops of honey onto a sheet of parchment paper using a spoon.

14.text: Insert lollipop sticks into the drops.

16.text: Preheat your oven to 275°F (135°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

17.text: Unwrap the Jolly Ranchers, and arrange them side-by-side in small groups on the parchment paper.

18.text: Bake the Jolly Ranchers for 5 to 7 minutes, or until they melt.

19.text: Take the Jolly Ranchers out of the oven, then insert the lollipop sticks.

20.text: Let the lollipops cool and harden.
